page.title: 18Memories of Local People 2
page.content: Fishing. The average caught in a year on one short stretch of the river at Grandtully,was 200 to 250. They always fished with fly rods. {Grouse}were also shot in huge numbers in the area. Now much of the hillsides are covered in trees. {The schools}were very different to what they are now.At Lady Steuart's School,near Grandtully Church,the children got soup for their lunch only in the winter time.It was made at Westpark and was carried down to the school in a tin. Every Christmas the children were measured for a cloak. This was a gift from Lady Steuart and was to keep the children warm throughout the winter.
